name: Vectary X LottieFiles X Iconscout
description:
LottieFiles x Vectary

In this tutorial, we show how to bring your assets from Figma to Vectary. We will show you how to work with extrudes, lighting, background coloring, camera angles, and more. All this inside Vectary so we can create beautiful perspective mockups. We will import 3D assets from Iconscout into Vectary, and in some cases, we will show you how to export some of the 3D assets in obj using Blender. We will also show you how to add Lottie animations as textures inside the 3D models and export the final art to Figma and implement them in Webflow.


  • Clone the Vectary project: https://app.vectary.com/project/?next=%2Fstudio%2F%3Fclone%3D81874fe7-d8d7-4c62-80c6-4968aa63c5d6
  • Try Vectary Studio Beta: https://www.vectary.com


  • Figma exercise file: https://www.figma.com/community/file/1090232335370431514


  • Iconscout assets : https://iconscout.com/3ds/abstract


  • All assets ( AE Files, Figma files, Iconscout assets and Lottie Aninations ) : https://drive.google.com/file/d/12vKrHfpEKV-2Pjbz7ezChQ-ifFFJ-Ifm/view?usp=drivesdk


Iconscout x Vectary

Did you ever wonder how to create beautiful perspective mockups? In this tutorial we will show you how to do it in simple steps and a few minutes with the help of Figma, Iconscout, and Vectary.We will cover topics like Creating your token in Figma so that you can copy and paste your Figma frames into Vectary. We will show you how to add lighting, background color, 3D assets import, and more.


- Clone the Vectary project: https://app.vectary.com/p/6HORZisjIedxbiflyvvOZV


  • Try Vectary Studio Beta: https://www.vectary.com


  • Figma exercise file: https://www.figma.com/community/file/1090232335370431514


  • Iconscout assets : https://iconscout.com/3ds/abstract


  • All assets ( AE Files, Figma files, Iconscout assets and Lottie Aninations ) : https://drive.google.com/file/d/12vKrHfpEKV-2Pjbz7ezChQ-ifFFJ-Ifm/view?usp=drivesdk
